subsection.name: Download
subsection.p: First download jWebUnit from the files area and expand to a local directory.

subsection.name: Choose what plugin you want to use
subsection.p:
There are currently 3 available plugins:
HttpUnit: Was the first supported plugin. Javascript support is very basic.
HtmlUnit: A real solution if you want better Javascript support.
Jacobie: You can run your tests directly in Ms Internet Explorer (Windows Only).

subsection.name: Integrate with IDE
subsection.p: The simplest way to manage dependencies is to use Maven 2. If you don't want to migrate to Maven, make sure you add the XXX-plugin (where XXX is the plugin you choose) and core jar files to your classpath in your IDE. You will also need numerous additionnal dependencies, depending on what plugin you choose. Please refer to each plugin page to know the dependencies they need.

subsection.name: Create test
subsection.p: Create your first webunit test. Start slow by asserting the title of your page.
